name: XVerExtensionEvidenceVariable.characteristic
title: Cross-Version Extension for FHIR R5:EvidenceVariable.characteristic compared to FHIR R4
description: R5 `EvidenceVariable.characteristic` maps as RelatedTo to R4 `EvidenceVariable.characteristic` - characteristic made the element mandatory; characteristic increased the minimum cardinality from 0 to 1

element.short: A defining factor of the EvidenceVariable
element.definition: A defining factor of the EvidenceVariable. Multiple characteristics are applied with "and" semantics.
element.comment:
R5 `EvidenceVariable.characteristic` maps as RelatedTo to R4 `EvidenceVariable.characteristic` - characteristic made the element mandatory; characteristic increased the minimum cardinality from 0 to 1
Characteristics can be defined flexibly to accommodate different use cases for membership criteria, ranging from simple codes, all the way to using an expression language to express the criteria.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.short: Value of extension
element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Label for internal linking
element.definition: Label used for when a characteristic refers to another characteristic.

element.short: Natural language description of the characteristic
element.definition: A short, natural language description of the characteristic that could be used to communicate the criteria to an end-user.

element.short: Used for footnotes or explanatory notes
element.definition: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the characteristic.

element.short: Whether the characteristic is an inclusion criterion or exclusion criterion
element.definition: When true, this characteristic is an exclusion criterion. In other words, not matching this characteristic definition is equivalent to meeting this criterion.

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a Reference
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using a Reference.

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a Canonical
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using Canonical.

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a CodeableConcept
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using CodeableConcept.

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by an expression
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using Expression.
element.comment: When another element provides a definition of the characteristic, the definitionExpression content SHALL match the definition (only adding technical concepts necessary for implementation) without changing the meaning.

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by an id
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using id.

element.short: Defines the characteristic using type and value
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using both a type and value[x] elements.

element.short: Expresses the type of characteristic
element.definition: Used to express the type of characteristic.

element.short: Method for how the characteristic value was determined
Device used for determining characteristic
Defines the characteristic when coupled with characteristic.type
element.definition: Defines the characteristic when paired with characteristic.type.

element.short: Reference point for valueQuantity or valueRange
element.definition: Defines the reference point for comparison when valueQuantity or valueRange is not compared to zero.

element.short: Used to specify how two or more characteristics are combined
element.definition: Defines the characteristic as a combination of two or more characteristics.

element.short: all-of | any-of | at-least | at-most | statistical | net-effect | dataset
element.definition: Used to specify if two or more characteristics are combined with OR or AND.

element.short: Provides the value of "n" when "at-least" or "at-most" codes are used
A defining factor of the characteristic
Number of occurrences meeting the characteristic
Length of time in which the characteristic is met
Timing in which the characteristic is determined
Human readable description
Used for footnotes or explanatory notes
element.definition: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the timeFromEvent.

element.short: The event used as a base point (reference point) in time
Used to express the observation at a defined amount of time before or after the event
Used to express the observation within a period before and/or after the event
A defining factor of the EvidenceVariable
